text: Psalm 54
Answered Prayer for Deliverance from Adversaries
For the \add music\add* director, with stringed instruments.
A maskil of David,
when the Ziphites went and said to Saul,
“Is not David hiding himself among us?”\f + \fr Ps 54 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O God, by your name save me,
and by your power vindicate me.
O God, hear my prayer;
heed the words of my mouth.
For foreigners have risen against me,
and ruthless \add men\add* seek my life.
They have not set God before them. \qs Selah\qs*
See, God \add is\add* my helper;
The Lord \add is\add* with those who sustain my life.\f + \fr 54:4 \ft Or “The Lord \fq is \ft the sustainer of my life.” \f*
He will repay\f + \fr 54:5 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* my enemies for their\f + \fr 54:5 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* evil;
in your faithfulness destroy them.
I will freely sacrifice to you;
I will give thanks \add to\add* your name,
O Yahweh, because \add it is\add* good.
Because he has delivered me from all trouble,
and my eye has looked \add with satisfaction\add* on my enemies.
